org.smartfrog.services.anubis.partition.protocols.heartbeat.ping
Class PingProtocolImpl

java.lang.Object
  org.smartfrog.services.anubis.partition.views.BitView
      org.smartfrog.services.anubis.partition.protocols.heartbeat.ping.PingProtocolImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, HeartbeatProtocol, HeartbeatReceiver, Sender, Timed, View
public class PingProtocolImpl
extends BitView
implements HeartbeatProtocol

This version of the heartbeat protocol measures round trip times for pings using the local clock. The heartbeat messages carry bits that represent pings. One end initiates pinging and the other responds. So the one end sends a set bit until it sees a set bit in return. When it does it records the time and changes to sending a cleared bit. When it sees a cleared bit it records the time and changes back to sending a set bit. The other end does the reverse - it sends a cleared bit until it sees a set bit, and then sends a set bit until it sees a cleared bit. The time between one bit flip and the next is a round trip time. The protocol uses the (local clock) times to measure the round trip and determine timeliness, so this protocol works without synchronized clocks. Essentially it only measures measage transmission delay and scheduling delay, not clock skew. However, as the clocks are not measured, the upper layers cannot rely on timestamps to represent a global time reference. Accordingly the partition stability time reference is meansingless across the partition, it only reflects the local time when the partition stablizes. Hence view time stamps are not reported.

isNotTimely

public boolean isNotTimely(long timenow,
                           long timebound)
indicates if the heartbeat protocol is timely. This method is called periodically by the connectionSet as part of a connection cleanup action. "Timelyness" is relative to the current time (timenow) and the timebound.

Specified by:
isNotTimely in interface HeartbeatProtocol
Parameters:
timenow - current time
timebound - expiration period
Returns:
true if expried, false if not

isQuiesced

public boolean isQuiesced(long timenow,
                          long quiesce)
indicates if the heartbeat protocol has quiesced. When the protocol has expired it will be inactive for a period before it can be removed. This is used to avoid another instance of the protocol being created as soon as this one expires (the partition protocol requires that connections remain inactive for a period after they expire). The quiescence is relative to the current time and the quiesce timeout.

Specified by:
isQuiesced in interface HeartbeatProtocol
Parameters:
timenow - current time
quiesce - quesce timeout - must be greater than expire timeout*2
Returns:
true if expired, false if not

measuresClockSkew

public boolean measuresClockSkew()
This protocol does not measure clock skew. It is in fact independent of clock skew because it uses only the local clock times to determine timeliness.

Specified by:
measuresClockSkew in interface HeartbeatProtocol
Returns:
boolean

receiveHeartbeat

public boolean receiveHeartbeat(Heartbeat hb)
receives a heartbeat message and deals with it according to the heartbeat protocol. This is protocol uses straight-forward timing of messages - only he most recent message time and its information counts.
